Ingredients:
1. ¼ cup of olive oil, 1 onion chopped, 2 carrots chopped, 4 garlic clove minced 2. 1 tsp curry powder & ½ tsp dried thyme,1 large can diced tomatoes 3. 1 cup brown or green lentils, 4 cups vegetable broth, 2 cups water, 1 tsp salt 4. Pinch of red pepper flakes, black pepper, 1 tbsp lemon juice
Recipe:
1. Warm the olive oil in pot, add the chopped onion and carrot and cook, 5 mins 2. Add the curry powder and thyme. Stir. Pour in the drained diced tomatoes and cook 3. Pour in the lentils and the water. Add 1 tsp salt & red pepper flakes with black pepper and cook 30 mins 4. Transfer 2 cups of the soup to a blender. and purée the soup until smooth. Pour the puréed soup back into the pot. 5. Add the chopped greens and cook for 5 more minutes, stir in 1 tbsp of lemon juice and serve

Ingredients:
1. ½ wholemeal pitta, ½ tbsp rapeseed oil, 1 tsp Tabasco, 1 tbsp low-fat mayonnaise, 1 tsp low-sugar, low-salt ketchup 2. 1 tbsp fat-free natural yogurt, ½ lime , zested and juiced, plus wedges to serve, 60g cooked king prawns 3. 1 Little Gem lettuce , ¼ small cucumber , 4 cherry tomatoes
Recipes:
1. Heat the oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Slice the pitta into triangles, put on a baking sheet and drizzle over the oil. Bake for 10-15 mins until golden and crisp. 2. Mix together the Tabasco, ketchup, mayo, yogurt and lime zest and juice. Toss the prawns in the dressing. 3. Layer the lettuce, cucumber, tomatoes and dressed prawns in a lunchbox or jar. Season, top with the pitta chips and serve with lime wedges.

Ingredients:
1. ½ x 200g pack melon medley, 150g pot fat-free yogurt, 2 tbsp fruit & fibre cereal, 1 tbsp mixed seed, 1 tsp clear honey
Recipes:
1. Top melon medley with yogurt, then sprinkle over cereal mixed with seeds. Drizzle over honey and eat immediately.

Ingredients:
1. 250g leek, 85g mascarpone, 1 tbsp chopped dill , plus 1 tsp. 2 skinless salmon fillets 2. ½ lemon , grated zest of 1/4, plus a good squeeze of juice, 2-3 tsp capers, baby potatoes and wilted spinach, to serve (optional)
Recipe:
1. Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Place two sheets of baking parchment (large enough to wrap up each salmon fillet) on your work surface. 2. Put the leeks in a pan with 6 tbsp water, cover and bring to the boil. Cook for 5 mins until the water has been absorbed and the leeks are almost tender. Stir in the mascarpone, 1 tbsp dill and some seasoning. 3. Spoon half the creamy leeks into the middle of one sheet of parchment and place a salmon fillet on top, then repeat to make a second parcel. Sprinkle over the lemon zest with a squeeze of juice, then scatter over the capers and the remaining 1 tsp dill. 4. Bring the parchment up over the fish and join the two edges together by folding them over several times down the middle. Do the same with the ends and place the parcels, spaced apart, on a baking sheet. 5. Bake for 12-15 mins, depending on how well done you like your fish, then carefully tear open the parcel. Serve with lemon wedges for squeezing over, baby potatoes and wilted spinach, if you like.

Ingredients:
1. 3 tbsp olive oil, 1 onion & 6 garlic cloves chopped. 1 ½ tsp fine sea salt. 2. 2 tsp paprika, 1 can diced tomatoes & chickpeas, 2 cups short-grain brown rice 3. 3 cups vegetable broth, 2 red peppers sliced, ½ cup Kalamata olives halved 4. Black pepper, ¼ cup chopped fresh parsley, 2 tbsp lemon juice, ½ cup frozen peas
Recipe:
1. Preheat the oven, heat 2 tbsp oil into pot, add onions & salt, 5 minutes 2. Stir in the garlic, paprika, tomatoes for 2 mins, then stir in rice until its coated and chickpeas 3. Increase the heat and bring mixture to boil. On baking combine the artichoke, peppers, chopped olives, 1 tablespoon of the olive oil, ½ teaspoon of the salt, and about 10 twists of freshly ground black pepper. Toss to combine, then spread the contents evenly across the pan. 4. Roast the vegetables on the upper rack until the artichokes and peppers are tender, about 40 to 45 minutes. remove and let vegetable cool. Serve
